summary: This is a confidential memorandum from the Federal Bureau of Prisons regarding the feeding of inmate Jeffrey Epstein in an attorney conference room at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on July 23, 2019. The document appears to be a clarification or denial from a Cook Supervisor regarding instructions about feeding Epstein.

persons.name: Rocco Lupo
persons.context: Recipient of the memorandum regarding authorization to feed meals in the attorney conference room.

persons.name: Cook Supervisor
persons.context: Author of the memorandum, clarifying that they never stated their supervisor instructed them to feed inmate Epstein inside the attorney conference room.

persons.name: Inmate Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was reportedly being fed inside the attorney conference room at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

connections.description: Cook Supervisor is writing a memorandum to Food Service Administrator Rocco Lupo regarding feeding procedures.
Cook Supervisor is involved in the process of feeding inmate Epstein, specifically addressing where meals were served.

events.title: Epstein fed in attorney conference room
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was reportedly being fed inside an attorney conference room at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, inmate Jeffrey Epstein was being fed inside an attorney conference room at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
A Cook Supervisor wrote a memorandum to Food Service Administrator Rocco Lupo regarding authorization to feed meals in the attorney conference room.
The Cook Supervisor explicitly denies having stated that their supervisor instructed them to feed inmate Epstein inside the attorney conference room.
The document is marked as confidential and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case files.
